MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Alan Turing | b: Donald Hebb | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: What was the purpose of the early machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s?
Choices: a: To calculate winning chances in checkers | b: To analyze sonar signals | c: To recognize speech patterns | d: To study human cognitive processes

MCQ: Which book by Canadian psychologist Donald Hebb introduced a theoretical neural structure that influenced the development of machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: The Organization of Behavior | b: Computing Machinery and Intelligence | c: Learning Machines | d: The Organization of Artificial Neurons

MCQ: What is the operational definition of machine learning according to Tom M. Mitchell?
Choices: a: Machines can think like humans | b: Machines can learn from experience and improve performance | c: Machines can recognize patterns accurately | d: Machines can predict future outcomes

MCQ: What are the two main objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To analyze historical data and predict future outcomes | b: To classify data based on models and make predictions | c: To study human cognitive processes and develop AI | d: To create self-teaching computers and improve machine performance
